image.altText: Protesters on the steps of SA Parliament House.

props.synopsis: A proposed restructure of the South Australian Museum which would have seen 27 full-time positions abolished has been "withdrawn", following a state government review.

title.children: Controversial museum 'reimagining' vetoed as SA government promises 'recalibrated' future

image.altText: Josh Lush

props.synopsis: Some South Australian farmers are reporting an 80 per cent loss in yield after frost devastated crops across the state, leaving paddocks "pretty much turning brown".

title.children: Frost crushes farmers' hopes of turning around 'worst ever' season

image.altText: Whyalla Steelworks, generic

props.synopsis: The story of Whyalla has been told and retold, and is often framed as a tale of a town and its steel plant. That is not an inaccurate picture, but nor is it a complete one.

title.children: Australia's 'only' rail manufacturer is a 'strategic' asset, but is steeling itself for bad news

image.altText: job advertisements page of the Courier Mail

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate remained at 4.2 per cent in August, as employment grew by 47,500 people.

title.children: Australia's unemployment rate remains steady in August at 4.2 per cent

image.altText: Isaac Heeney, Zak Butters, Jeremy Cameron, Joe Daniher

props.synopsis: The race for the AFL premiership is down to just four teams. Here is what they need to nail this week in order to book a grand final spot.

title.children: Breaking down the AFL's final four and the secret weapons that could decide this year's grand finalists

image.altText: Two men stand together

props.synopsis: An Adelaide family's plan to move into a retirement village with their adult son, who lives with cerebral palsy, is coming unstuck because operators say he is too young to join them.

title.children: Adelaide family denied place in retirement villages due to adult son with disability

image.altText: A young woman in a dimly lit venue.

props.synopsis: Organising a night out is exhausting work for young people with disabilities like Alessa — from checking the terrain, doorways, entrances, and adequate space for a wheelchair.

title.children: When a simple night out on the town can take weeks of research

image.altText: A black and white camera image of a driver using a mobile phone with two hands.

props.synopsis: Police will begin issuing fines of more than $600 to motorists caught using a mobile phone while driving at five locations across Adelaide tomorrow, as a three-month grace period ends.

title.children: 'Definition of stupidity': Four drivers caught on camera flouting mobile phone driving rules 30 times, police say

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds Toto outside the Lodge

props.synopsis: A political stunt over housing policy meant Labor was this week reminded that while it might be in government, it doesn't have control of the Senate.

title.children: Toto's warning barks weren't heeded as Albanese tone soured in tense interview

image.altText: A man and woman with grey hair, and a young woman, leave a concrete building.

props.synopsis: Diabetic William Herbert Swale, 67, is a free man after a magistrate said he had no case to answer over the 2023 crash that killed five outside a country Victoria hotel.

title.children: 'Zero justice': Grieving families question legal system as Daylesford pub crash driver walks free

image.altText: A woman in military uniform looks through a pair of binoculars on the deck of a ship.

props.synopsis: It follows recommendations from the royal commission into veteran suicides to investigate the impact of sexual violence within the ADF more broadly.

title.children: Not safe for women? New data shows ADF struggling to bring down rates of harassment

image.altText: Men holding flags in front of the parliament 'Beehive' building.

props.synopsis: New Zealand has entered a period of right-wing politics, but the next generation of Māori activists are ready to respond.

title.children: NZ is debating a referendum that some fear 'would be the worst of all worlds'

image.altText: An injured person is wheeled on a stretcher

props.synopsis: While Israel's alleged involvement in the pager and hand-held radio attacks in Lebanon may never be confirmed, the country's security and intelligence agencies have been linked to a string of assassination plots over the years.

title.children: Before pagers and walkie-talkies, Israel allegedly used poisonous toothpaste and muscle relaxants to deal with their enemies

image.altText: Man on an exercise bike in a gym, other men in similar uniforms, of blue and white stripes in the background.

props.synopsis: Twelve years ago, three middle-aged farmers decided to get fit. Now they are part of a movement that's improving the mental and physical health of rural communities.

title.children: Ben and his mates were overweight. What they did next changed the lives of many 'fat farmers' like them

image.altText: George Speight wears a dark suit as he is lead from a courthouse by two large policemen in khaki uniforms.

props.synopsis: Failed coup leader George Speight, who was originally sentenced to death for treason, has been released from a Fijian jail after receiving a presidential pardon.

title.children: Failed Fijian coup leader George Speight released from prison after receiving presidential pardon

image.altText: Sophie Garbin catches the ball while under pressure from Razia Quashie.

props.synopsis: Australia enjoys the upper hand in the opening quarter against England, as the three-Test series gets underway in Adelaide. Follow live.

title.children: World champion Diamonds make positive start against England in first Test

image.altText: People walk across a street.

props.synopsis: Australia is now home to more than 27 million people but policies over the last decade have failed to deliver the housing needed, an expert warns.

title.children: Australia's population reaches 27 million with growth largely driven by overseas migration

image.altText: A composite of a man and a woman

props.synopsis: The US Federal Reserve cuts interest rates for the first time since the pandemic, and with the race for the White House in full swing both sides of politics move to push their narratives around what it means for the economy.

title.children: A US interest rate drop should be good for Harris and bad for Trump, but nothing is as it seems in 2024

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie at press conference

props.synopsis: The government has faced a grilling over the curious release of a secret military report, insisting it had no role in its publication.

title.children: Labor rejects claims it tried to cover up release of secret military report

image.altText: An Indigenous man in a black jacket looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Witnesses have given evidence to the Truth-Telling and Healing Inquiry about growing up in Cherbourg, a government-run Aboriginal mission that still evokes traumatic memories for many First Nations survivors.

title.children: 'Bad things happened' to children forced to live with adult strangers on mission, inquiry hears

image.altText: Delegates sit in a semi-circle shape and look at a large stage and screens.

props.synopsis: The UN General Assembly overwhelmingly supports a resolution demanding Israel end its occupation of Gaza and the occupied West Bank within a year, but Australia abstains from the vote.

title.children: Australia abstains as UN General Assembly votes to demand Israel end Palestinian occupation

image.altText: A large cloud of smoke and flames lights up a dark sky.

props.synopsis: Unverified video of the blast, which reportedly forced the evacuation of a nearby town, showed a huge ball of flame blowing up into the night sky.

title.children: Ukrainian drone strike causes major blast at Russian arsenal that was said to be 'reliable and safe storage'

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering 23-year-old Victorian woman Hannah McGuire has elected to fast-track the matter to the Supreme Court for trial.

title.children: Hannah McGuire accused pleads not guilty to murder, will stand trial in Supreme Court

image.altText: A real estate listing of a 3-bedroom unit, with a picture of a large outdoor area at the top of the page.

props.synopsis: The three-bedroom property near Bronte Beach, listed for $950 a week, is only accessible through a kindergarten below, with tenants unable to leave or enter outside of its opening hours.

title.children: 'Red flags are flying high': Sydney rental listing locks out tenants for 10 hours a day

image.altText: A Bedouin rides a horse as a Harvest Supermoon is pictured in the background, in Rahat, southern Israel.

props.synopsis: From country to country, keen stargazers have diligently captured the September harvest supermoon.

title.children: Harvest supermoon lights up night skies and landmarks all over the world

image.altText: A woman sits at a desk with a keyboard, her pregnant belly is visible.

props.synopsis: Parents accessing the government-funded paid parental leave will receive an additional 12 per cent of their payments in super from July next year, after the federal government's legislation passed parliament.

title.children: Superannuation for parents on government-funded PPL passes parliament

image.altText: Two Melbourne Stars WBBL players before a match in 2018.

props.synopsis: Dulip Samaraweera is banned from holding any position within Cricket Australia or a state or territory association after he was found to have "engaged in inappropriate behaviour".

title.children: Cricket Australia bans ex-Sri Lankan Test player for 20 years after 'serious breach' of code of conduct

image.altText: A woman looks in the mirror while holding her hair back.

props.synopsis: When Demi Moore's character in The Substance turns 50, she gets fired. That's when things start to get weird.

title.children: Would you take a miracle drug for eternal youth? Demi Moore does in The Substance, with horrific results

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Former army officer cadet Jake Sullivan is on trial for six charges including rape, committing an act of indecency and assault.

title.children: 'I never forced her': Former army cadet denies raping woman

image.altText: Jon Doust

props.synopsis: Older Australians are the most likely to be involved in a crash on the road, and men speed more than women, according to a decade of figures compiled by a national insurer.

title.children: Insurance claim data reveals men and over-65 drivers most likely to crash cars

image.altText: Portrait of woman sitting on a couch holding a white mug of tea

props.synopsis: When a town in Australia's South West was forced to switch off gas, residents were given a choice: use bottled gas or electrify. Now, electricity is providing more energy for Esperance than ever before and most of it is coming from renewable sources.

title.children: Forced to switch off gas, this small Australian seaside town became a 'microcosm of what the world is trying to do'

image.altText: A portrait of woman in a large room.

props.synopsis: Dr Anita Hutchison is supporting a pilot program that will train GPs to recognise the signs of domestic violence and child sexual abuse.

title.children: Anita says she was asked 'can't you just forgive him?' as she tried to flee domestic violence. She wants that to change

image.altText: Ballarat Grammar School

props.synopsis: A staff member from Ballarat Grammar in Victoria is recovering in hospital after losing consciousness on a school scuba diving trip at St Leonards.

title.children: Staff member resuscitated after near drowning on private school scuba trip

image.altText: An Australian senator in a red jacket.

props.synopsis: Senators found many medical students get just an hour of training in the subject despite half the country going through it at some stage.

title.children: 'Irrational, hysterical or crazy': Senate inquiry recommends reproductive leave for all as it calls for medical profession to step up
